edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:25): it means b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea can go to meetings and I can relax in SF :p

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:31): you know, I've been thinking, the really large number of things that have gotten added to the platform over the last 3 years especially, all this stuff getting implemented, e.g., latest news about new features in IE10
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:32): those are clear signs that we are all doing something wrong
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:32): forgetting what we're here for
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (11:33): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: explain
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:34): well, I mean, we should spend less time on that stuff -- forget about, say, writing test cases for the history API
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:34): and instead we should use that time to discuss stuff like "consider reducing verbosity when talking about code points"
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:38): man, I like it when people drop links to the HTML version of the ES5 specs
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:38): https://twitter.com/#!/wycats/status/114237748843524097
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:39): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2, hahaha
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:39): but now TC39 is going to ruin it by making ES6 and obsoleting it all
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:40): ECMAScript should move to the W3C I think
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:40): yeah, it should
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:40): should have been there to begin with
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:40): having to join a separate standards organization with its own fees and rules is somewhat annoying
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:40): and I think at that point the reason we're not joining
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:41): Bert Bos would have been annoyed, but that's okay; I'm sure he's no fan of XSL-FO either
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:41): I don't think Bert was to blame for that decision
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:42): I've heard other names
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:42): the discussion is probably documented somewhere
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:42): karlcow would probably know
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:42): anyway, ancient history
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:43): for now, it would be nice at least if ECMA and the TC would join us here in this century and actually make the normative spec available in HTML form
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:43): with actual useful cross-references and such
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:45): https://twitter.com/#!/reinmarpl/status/113995021006536704
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:45): Edward V Berard: ‚ÄòWalking on water and developing software from a specification are easy, if both are frozen‚Äô

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (11:46): just look for people who tweet about es5.github.com
